intro: Cestichis lyonii, commonly known as Lyon's cestichis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
